results.title: Kaante
results.creator_credit: Sanjay Gupta, Pritish Nandy Communications and Raju Patel
results.brief_description: This Bollywood remake of “Reservoir dogs” (Tarantino, 1992) is a lot of fun to watch with its musical numbers and an inventive reworking of the central narrative about a gang of criminals who are infiltrated by an undercover cop. After pulling off a daring bank robbery, and lucky escape from the law, the band retreat to sniff out the nark among them. Featuring sprightly performances by Amitabh Bachchan, Sanjay Dutt, Suniel Shetty, Mahesh Manjrekar, Lucky Ali and Kumar Gaurav, the narrative also addresses ethnic stereotyping as the crew lament their treatment at the hands of the Los Angeles Police Department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sanjay Gupta, Pritish Nandy Communications and Raju Patel

results.title: Ka-wayawayama: Aeroplane Dance
results.creator_credit: Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham, Christina Pozzan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Records the story of “Ka-wayawayama” or “Aeroplane Dance” of the Yanuwa people of the Borroloola area in the Northern Territory. The dance was created after an American “Liberator” bomber crashed in the area in 1942, after a mission in the South-west Pacific. Re-creates the plight of the flight crew in their trek across inhospitable terrain across the Gulf of Carpentaria and the search for the lost crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham, Christina Pozzan and Film Australia

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (November 2008)
results.brief_description: These eight Digital Stories were created by members of the general public in Melbourne, Victoria. Mostly concerned with the concept of home, these eight different people provide a variety of perspectives.

results.title: The Soul of St Kilda

results.title: K.C.I.: beyond the three r's
results.creator_credit: Scott Barrie, Arthur Ham, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Kitchener Waterloo Collegiate and Vocational School embodies some of the best features of public secondary education today. The school encourages students to learn beyond the classroom through innovative programs like Cooperative Education or Community Involvement, and welcomes adults into the school to complete their education or upgrade their skills. Through candid views of school activities, classroom discussions, and interviews with staff and students, the film takes its audience through a busy day at a large urban high school. It approaches many of the questions in the current debate on education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Barrie, Arthur Ham, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Just the job
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Jenny Day and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description: Designed as an aid for those who are about to leave school and try for a place in the work force. Outlines the kind of trade and post-trade courses available, as well as basic apprenticeship courses and development courses for various skills. Explains the need to find out as much as possible about a job, to ask questions, and talk to teachers.

results.title: A Dream to create a home
results.creator_credit: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wendy Walters and her group of passionate people set about building a home for ninety people in Mill Park, Victoria. Through the dreams and idealism is frustration at the struggle to make this building home for so many different people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
